Quickstart Guide: Upload Creative and Create a Campaign

Authorization-Guide.title: Sign Up and Authentication Quickstart Guide
Authorization-Guide.description: To gain access to IQM's API and its services, first the user must sign up and log in to obtain the authentication required to send requests.

Guidelines/Bid-Model-API-Guidelines.title: Bid Model API
Guidelines/Bid-Model-API-Guidelines.description: The Bid Model API allows users to optimize their advertising campaigns for better performance. The user can fine-tune metrics such as where their ads appear (Include/Exclude), campaign priority management, and dimensions by which a campaign is subdivided.

Guidelines/Campaign-API-Guidelines.title: Campaign API
Guidelines/Campaign-API-Guidelines.description: This page will cover the common endpoints and methods for managing campaigns in IQM's rest API.

Guidelines/Conversion-API-Guidelines.title: Conversions API
Guidelines/Conversion-API-Guidelines.description: IQM's Conversions API allows the user to manage and get details on conversions.

Guidelines/Finance-Guidelines.title: Finance API
Guidelines/Finance-Guidelines.description: This page covers the methods and endpoints associated with managing finance operations. In addition to general finance details and lists, there are sections coevering invoice, credit, and payment management.

Guidelines/Insights-API-Guidelines.title: Insights API
Guidelines/Insights-API-Guidelines.description: Audience insights provide in-depth reports of audience characteristics, itnerests, and behaviors to give advertisers a deeper understanding of thier taret audience and create targeted and personalized advertising strategies. This page covers the various methods and endpoints for insights details and management, as well as Voter Level Data reports details and management.

Guidelines/Inventory-API-Guide.title: Inventory API
Guidelines/Inventory-API-Guide.description: IQM's advanced algorithm deterines the most relevant ads to display to a user based on their activity and the content of a given page. Inventories provide advertisers a way to organize collecions or groups based on criteria such as ad format, placement type, targeting options, and other attributes. Private Marketplace (PMP) deals and Programmatic Guarantee (PG) deals are arranged so advertisers can purchase ad inventory. This page will cover common methods and endpoints associated with Inventories, PMP Deals, PG Deals, and Groups.

Guidelines/Master-API-Guidelines.title: Master API
Guidelines/Master-API-Guidelines.description: The master API uses the same Header Parameters for all endpoints:

Guidelines/Reports-API-Guidelines.title: Reports API
Guidelines/Reports-API-Guidelines.description: Get details and track data of various metrics of a campaign with this API.

Guidelines/User-Profile-Guidelines.title: User Management API
Guidelines/User-Profile-Guidelines.description: IQM's REST API allows you to manage users and their profiles in several different ways.

Guidelines/Workspace-Guidelines.title: Organization, Workspace, And Customer Guidelines
Guidelines/Workspace-Guidelines.description: This page covers the common methods and endpoints for managing Organizations, Workspaces, Customers and Advertisers. Organizations are top-level descriptions of a company's profile, including its name, website, and location details. Workspaces operate within organizations and can be Customers or Advertisers. Users operate within Workspaces and can be assigned Customers.

intro.title: IQM API
intro.description: IQM’s REST API enables you to interact with most of IQM’s offerings.
